summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting an interview with a Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center Lieutenant regarding the events at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019 involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The document details the voluntary nature of the interview and a procedural error in form administration.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The interview is related to actions at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019 specifically involving him as an inmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Interviewed regarding the events at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019 involving Jeffrey Epstein. She was informed the interview was voluntary and related to a criminal investigation.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Present for the interview at the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: TFO
persons.role: Task Force Officer (NYPD detective assigned to FBI)
persons.context: Present for the interview, assigned as a Task Force Officer to the FBI.

connections.description: SA interviewed Lieutenant regarding events involving Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.
Lieutenant was a BOP officer at the MCC where Epstein was an inmate.

events.title: Events at MCC involving Epstein
events.description: Actions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center the night of August 9, 2019 involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Events at MCC involving Epstein
events.description: Actions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019 involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: OIG interview of MCC Lieutenant
events.description: Interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agent with a BOP MCC Lieutenant regarding the events of August 9-10, 2019 involving Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The interview focuses on events at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 9-10, 2019 involving Jeffrey Epstein.
The MCC Lieutenant was informed this was a criminal investigation and her participation was voluntary.
The OIG Special Agent mistakenly provided the wrong form (DOJ OIG Form 1II-22613 instead of Form III-226/2) to the Lieutenant during the interview.
All present believed the Lieutenant understood her interview and answers were voluntary and not compelled.
This document is an OIG memorandum that contains neither recommendations nor conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
